question_text: Is the Factory License valid and current for the present year?
applicability_criteria: All factories employing 10 or more workers (with power) or 20 or more (without power).
simplified_guidance:
1. Ask for the original 'Factory License' (Form 4). 
2. Check the 'Valid Until' date.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload valid Form 4 License or Renewal Receipt.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Upload challan showing renewal fees paid.

legal_text: Section 6(1)(d): The State Government may make rules requiring the registration and licensing of factories... and prescribing the fees payable for such registration and licensing and for the renewal of licences.

question_text: Has the Occupier sent a written notice to the Chief Inspector at least 15 days before occupying the premises?
applicability_criteria: New factories or factories resuming work after >180 days shutdown.
simplified_guidance:
1. Ask for the 'Notice of Occupation' (Form 2). 
2. Check the date of submission vs date of start.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload stamped copy of Form 2 (Notice of Occupation).
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Draft notice or proof of dispatch.

legal_text: Section 7(1): The occupier shall, at least fifteen days before he begins to occupy or use any premises as a factory, send to the Chief Inspector a written notice containing... the name and situation of the factory, the name and address of the occupier...

question_text: Are dirt and refuse removed daily from floors, benches, staircases, and passages?
simplified_guidance:
1. Walk through the shop floor. 
2. Check corners, under benches, and staircases for accumulated dust/waste.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Wide angle photo of clean floor/aisle.

legal_text: Section 11(1)(a): Accumulation of dirt and refuse shall be removed daily by sweeping or by any other effective method from the floors and benches of workrooms and from staircases and passages.

question_text: Is the floor of every workroom washed with disinfectant at least once a week?
simplified_guidance:
1. Ask for the Housekeeping Register. 
2. Check for weekly entries of 'Washing with Disinfectant'.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload copy of the weekly washing log.

legal_text: Section 11(1)(b): The floor of every workroom shall be cleaned at least once in every week by washing, using disinfectant, where necessary, or by some other effective method.

question_text: Are walls and ceilings repainted or varnished at least once every 5 years?
simplified_guidance:
1. Check the 'Lime Washing Register' (Form 7). 
2. Verify the last date of painting/varnishing. 
3. Look for peeling paint on walls.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload Form 7 (Record of Lime Washing/Painting).

legal_text: Section 11(1)(d): All inside walls and partitions... where they are painted... be repainted or revarnished at least once in every period of five years.

question_text: Are effective arrangements made for the treatment and disposal of wastes and effluents?
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect the Effluent Treatment Plant (ETP) if applicable. 
2. Check for overflow or leakage. 
3. Verify connection to authorized disposal channels.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of ETP or waste disposal area.

legal_text: Section 12(1): Effective arrangements shall be made in every factory for the treatment of wastes and effluents due to the manufacturing process carried on therein, so as to render them innocuous, and for their disposal.

question_text: Is there adequate ventilation and temperature control?
simplified_guidance:
1. Walk the floor. Does it feel suffocating? 
2. Are exhaust fans running? 
3. Check if workers are visibly sweating excessively due to lack of airflow.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of ventilation fans/ducts.

legal_text: Section 13(1): Effective and suitable provision shall be made... for securing and maintaining... adequate ventilation by the circulation of fresh air, and such a temperature as will secure to workers therein reasonable conditions of comfort.

question_text: Are measures taken to prevent inhalation of dust and fumes?
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify dust sources (Grinding/Mixing). 
2. Check if Local Exhaust Ventilation (hoods) is installed AT THE SOURCE. 
3. Ensure it is switched on.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of extraction hood near the machine.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Design plan for new ventilation system.

legal_text: Section 14(1): In every factory in which... there is given off any dust or fume... effective measures shall be taken to prevent its inhalation... and if any exhaust appliance is necessary for this purpose, it shall be applied as near as possible to the point of origin.

question_text: Is the room free from overcrowding injurious to health?
simplified_guidance:
1. General observation: Are workers bumping into each other? 
2. Minimum space: 14.2 cubic meters per worker (for post-1948 factories).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Wide photo of the work floor showing spacing.

legal_text: Section 16(1): No room in any factory shall be overcrowded to an extent injurious to the health of the workers employed therein.

question_text: Is sufficient and suitable lighting provided in all work areas?
simplified_guidance:
1. Check for dark corners or flickering lights. 
2. Ensure no glare on screens/worktables. 
3. Verify emergency lights are present.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of illuminated work area.

legal_text: Section 17(1): In every part of a factory where workers are working or passing there shall be provided and maintained sufficient and suitable lighting, natural or artificial, or both.

question_text: Is sufficient wholesome drinking water provided?
simplified_guidance:
1. Check water coolers/taps. 
2. Are they working? 
3. Is the area clean? 
4. Ask for Water Test Report.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload water potability test certificate.

legal_text: Section 18(1): In every factory effective arrangements shall be made to provide and maintain at suitable points conveniently situated for all workers employed therein a sufficient supply of wholesome drinking water.

question_text: Is the drinking water point at least 6 meters away from latrines/urinals?
simplified_guidance:
1. Measure distance between Water Cooler and Toilet Door. 
2. Must be > 6 meters. 
3. If closer, check if it's enclosed and clearly marked.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo showing distance or proximity.

legal_text: Section 18(2): ...no such point shall be situated within six metres of any washing place, urinal, latrine, spittoon, open drain carrying sullage or effluent or any other source of contamination unless a shorter distance is approved in writing by the Chief Inspector.

question_text: Are sufficient latrines and urinals provided?
simplified_guidance:
1. Count toilets. 
2. Rule of thumb: 1 per 25 males, 1 per 25 females. 
3. Check if they are accessible and not locked.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of toilet block.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Layout for new toilet block construction.

legal_text: Section 19(1)(a): In every factory sufficient latrine and urinal accommodation of prescribed types shall be provided conveniently situated and accessible to workers at all times while they are at factory.

question_text: Are separate enclosed accommodation provided for male and female workers?
applicability_criteria: Factories with both male and female workers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check for 'Men' and 'Women' signs. 
2. Ensure entrances are separate. 
3. Ensure privacy (doors, partitions).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of separate male/female entrances.

legal_text: Section 19(1)(b): Separate enclosed accommodation shall be provided for male and female workers.

question_text: Is a notice regarding penalty for spitting displayed?
simplified_guidance:
1. Look for 'No Spitting' signs. 
2. The sign MUST mention the penalty (e.g., Fine Rs. 5).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the notice.

legal_text: Section 20(3): No person shall spit within the premises of a factory... and a notice containing this provision and the penalty for its violation shall be prominently displayed at suitable places.

question_text: Are all moving parts of prime movers and flywheels securely fenced?
applicability_criteria: All Factories using power (engines, motors, generators).
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify the 'Prime Mover' (Main Engine/Motor). 
2. Check if the flywheel and moving parts are covered by a solid guard. 
3. Shake the guard to ensure it is not loose.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the secure guard installed.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Purchase order for fabrication of guards.

legal_text: Section 21(1): In every factory the following, namely... (i) every moving part of a prime mover and every flywheel connected to a prime mover... shall be securely fenced by safeguards of substantial construction.

question_text: Is every part of the transmission machinery (belts, pulleys, shafts) securely fenced?
applicability_criteria: Factories with transmission systems (belts, pulleys, shafts).
simplified_guidance:
1. Look for exposed spinning shafts or belts. 
2. Ensure they are fully enclosed (mesh or solid). 
3. No nip-points should be accessible to a hand.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of belt/pulley guards.

legal_text: Section 21(1)(iv): ...every part of transmission machinery... and every dangerous part of any other machinery... shall be securely fenced.

question_text: Do workers examining or lubricating moving machinery wear tight-fitting clothing?
applicability_criteria: All Factories where maintenance on running machines is permitted.
simplified_guidance:
1. Observe maintenance staff. 
2. Ensure NO loose shirts, dhotis, or unbuttoned sleeves near moving parts. 
3. They must wear tight-fitting dungarees.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of maintenance worker in proper uniform.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Invoice for purchase of safety uniforms.

legal_text: Section 22(1): ...such examination or operation shall be made or carried out only by a specially trained adult male worker wearing tight fitting clothing (which shall be supplied by the occupier).

question_text: Are women and young persons prohibited from cleaning or lubricating machinery in motion?
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify company policy. 
2. Interview a supervisor. 
3. Ensure no woman or young person (15-18) is assigned dangerous maintenance tasks.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload Safety Policy/SOP prohibiting this practice.

legal_text: Section 22(2): No woman or young person shall be allowed to clean, lubricate or adjust any part of a prime mover or of any transmission machinery while... in motion.

question_text: Have young persons working on dangerous machines received sufficient training and supervision?
applicability_criteria: Factories employing Young Persons (15-18) on dangerous machines (Presses, Saws, etc.).
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify 'Dangerous Machines' (as per State Rules). 
2. If a young person is operating one, ask for their Training Record. 
3. Check for supervision.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload Training Certificate/Log for the young person.

legal_text: Section 23(1): No young person shall be required or allowed to work at any machine to which this section applies, unless he has been fully instructed... and has received sufficient training... or is under adequate supervision.

question_text: Is suitable striking gear provided to move driving belts?
simplified_guidance:
1. Check machines with belts. 
2. Is there a mechanical lever/gear to shift the belt? 
3. Workers MUST NOT shift belts by hand.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the striking gear mechanism.

legal_text: Section 24(1)(a): Suitable striking gear or other efficient mechanical appliance shall be provided and maintained and used to move driving belts to and from fast and loose pulleys.

question_text: Are devices for cutting off power in emergencies provided in every workroom?
simplified_guidance:
1. Locate the Red 'Emergency Stop' button (Mushroom head). 
2. Is it accessible? 
3. Is it clearly marked?

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the Emergency Stop button/switch.

legal_text: Section 24(2): In every factory suitable devices for cutting off power in emergencies from running machinery shall be provided and maintained in every workroom.

question_text: Are all set screws, bolts, and keys on revolving shafts sunk, encased, or guarded?
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect rotating shafts. 
2. Look for protruding bolts/screws that could catch clothing. 
3. They must be sunk (flush) or covered.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Close-up photo of a revolving shaft showing sunk/guarded bolts.

legal_text: Section 26(1)(a): In all machinery driven by power... every set screw, bolt or key on any revolving shaft, spindle, wheel or pinion shall be so sunk, encased or otherwise effectively guarded as to prevent danger.

question_text: Are hoists and lifts examined by a competent person at least once every 6 months?
simplified_guidance:
1. Ask for 'Form 11' (Register of Examination of Hoist). 
2. Check the last inspection date. 
3. Must be < 6 months ago.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload the latest Form 11 certificate.

legal_text: Section 28(1)(a)(ii): ...shall be thoroughly examined by a competent person at least once in every period of six months, and a register shall be kept containing the prescribed particulars.

question_text: Are hoistway gates fitted with interlocking devices?
simplified_guidance:
1. Test the gate: Can you open it when the lift is NOT there? (Should be NO). 
2. Test the lift: Can it move if the gate is OPEN? (Should be NO).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the interlocking mechanism.

legal_text: Section 28(1)(e): Every gate... shall be fitted with interlocking or other efficient device to secure that the gate cannot be opened except when the cage is at the landing and that the cage cannot be moved unless the gate is closed.

question_text: Are lifting machines, chains, and ropes examined by a competent person every 12 months?
applicability_criteria: Factories with Cranes, Chain Pulley Blocks, Slings.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify Lifting Gear. 
2. Ask for the Examination Register. 
3. Verify last inspection was < 12 months ago.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload 12-monthly examination certificate.

legal_text: Section 29(1)(a)(iii): ...thoroughly examined by a competent person at least once in every period of twelve months, or at such intervals as the Chief Inspector may specify.

question_text: Is the Safe Working Load (SWL) plainly marked on every lifting machine?
simplified_guidance:
1. Look at the Crane or Pulley Block. 
2. Is 'SWL 5 TON' (or similar) painted clearly on it? 
3. It must be visible from the floor.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the SWL marking on the machine.

legal_text: Section 29(1)(b): No lifting machine and no chain, rope or lifting tackle shall... be loaded beyond the safe working load which shall be plainly marked thereon.

question_text: Is a notice indicating the maximum safe working peripheral speed affixed near grinding machines?
applicability_criteria: Factories with Grinding Machines / Abrasive Wheels.
simplified_guidance:
1. Go to the grinding machine. 
2. Look for a plate/sticker stating 'Max RPM' or 'Peripheral Speed'. 
3. It must be permanently affixed.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the speed notice on the grinding machine.

legal_text: Section 30(1): In every factory in which the process of grinding is carried on there shall be permanently affixed to or placed near each machine... a notice indicating the maximum safe working peripheral speed.

question_text: Is a valid Hydrostatic Test Certificate available for all pressure vessels?
applicability_criteria: Factories with Boilers, Air Receivers, Autoclaves, or Steam Pipelines.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify pressure vessels (Air tanks, Boilers). 
2. Ask for 'Form 13' (Report of Examination). 
3. Check validity (External: 6m, Internal: 1y, Hydrostatic: 2-4y).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload valid Form 13/Hydrostatic Test Certificate signed by Competent Person.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Evidence of shutdown scheduled for testing.

legal_text: Section 31(1): If in any factory, any plant or machinery or any part thereof is operated at a pressure above atmospheric pressure, effective measures shall be taken to ensure that the safe working pressure of such plant or machinery or part is not exceeded.

question_text: Is the Safe Working Pressure (SWP) marked on the pressure plant?
simplified_guidance:
1. Look at the pressure gauge on the vessel. 
2. Is there a Red Line marking the max pressure? 
3. Is there a metal plate stating 'SWP'?

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the pressure gauge with red marking or SWP plate.

legal_text: Section 31(1): ...effective measures shall be taken to ensure that the safe working pressure of such plant or machinery or part is not exceeded.

question_text: Are floors, steps, and passages sound and free from obstruction?
simplified_guidance:
1. Walk the main aisles. 
2. Check for oil spills, loose wires, or broken tiles. 
3. Ensure paths are not blocked by raw material.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of clear, well-maintained walkway.

legal_text: Section 32(a): All floors, steps, stairs, passages and gangways shall be of sound construction and properly maintained and shall be kept free from obstructions and substances likely to cause persons to slip.

question_text: Are substantial handrails provided for all stairs?
simplified_guidance:
1. Check every staircase. 
2. Is there a handrail? 
3. Shake it - is it substantial (firm) or loose?

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the staircase showing handrails.

legal_text: Section 32(a): ...and where it is necessary to ensure safety, steps, stairs, passages and gangways shall be provided with substantial handrails.

question_text: Are all pits, sumps, and floor openings securely covered or fenced?
applicability_criteria: Factories with underground tanks, drainage pits, or floor openings.
simplified_guidance:
1. Look for holes/pits in the floor. 
2. Are they open? (Danger). 
3. They must have a heavy metal cover or a rigid fence around them.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the pit securely covered or fenced.

legal_text: Section 33(1): In every factory every fixed vessel, sump, tank, pit or opening in the ground or in a floor... shall be either securely covered or securely fenced.

question_text: Are suitable goggles provided and used for eye protection?
applicability_criteria: Factories with Welding, Grinding, or Chemical handling.
simplified_guidance:
1. Visit the welding/grinding station. 
2. Are workers wearing goggles/face shields? 
3. Verify stock of PPE in store.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of worker performing task wearing eye protection.

legal_text: Section 35: The State Government may by rules require that effective screens or suitable goggles shall be provided for the protection of persons employed on, or in the immediate vicinity of, the process.

question_text: Is portable electric light used inside confined spaces limited to 24 volts?
applicability_criteria: Factories where workers enter tanks, pits, or flues.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check the 'Inspection Lamp' used for tank cleaning. 
2. Check the transformer rating. 
3. It MUST be 24V (Low Voltage) to prevent electrocution.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the 24V transformer or lamp specs.

legal_text: Section 36A(a): No portable electric light or any other electric appliance of voltage exceeding twenty-four volts shall be permitted for use inside any chamber, tank, vat, pit, pipe, flue or other confined space.

question_text: Are safe means of escape provided and kept unlocked/unobstructed?
simplified_guidance:
1. Walk to all Emergency Exits. 
2. Try to open them (Must NOT be locked). 
3. Ensure the path is not blocked by boxes/machines.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of clear, unlocked Emergency Exit door.

legal_text: Section 38(1)(a): In every factory... safe means of escape for all persons in the event of a fire [shall be provided and maintained].

question_text: Is necessary fire extinguishing equipment provided and maintained?
simplified_guidance:
1. Check Fire Extinguishers. 
2. Are they present? 
3. Check the yellow tag: Is the 'Next Refill Date' in the future?

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of extinguisher showing valid refill tag.

legal_text: Section 38(1)(b): ...the necessary equipment and facilities for extinguishing fire [shall be provided].

question_text: Are workers trained in fire escape routines (Mock Drills)?
simplified_guidance:
1. Ask for the 'Mock Drill Register'. 
2. Verify a drill was conducted in the last 6 months (or as per state rules). 
3. Ask a random worker 'What do you do if the alarm rings?'.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload report/photos of the last Fire Mock Drill.

legal_text: Section 38(2): Effective measures shall be taken to ensure that in every factory all the workers are familiar with the means of escape in case of fire and have been adequately trained in the routine to be followed.

question_text: Are Safety Officers appointed?
applicability_criteria: Factories with > 1000 workers OR involved in hazardous processes.
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify worker count (>1000). 
2. If applicable, ask for the appointment letter and qualification of the Safety Officer.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload Appointment Letter of Safety Officer.

legal_text: Section 40B(1): In every factory wherein one thousand or more workers are ordinarily employed... the occupier shall... employ such number of Safety Officers as may be specified.

question_text: Has information regarding dangers and health hazards been disclosed to the workers?
simplified_guidance:
1. Check for Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS). 
2. Are they displayed in English AND local language? 
3. Interview a worker: Do they know the risks?

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of MSDS displayed on shop floor.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Draft copy of MSDS pending translation.

legal_text: Section 41B(1): The occupier of every factory involving a hazardous process shall disclose in the manner prescribed all information regarding dangers, including health hazards... to the workers employed in the factory.

question_text: Are accurate medical records maintained for workers exposed to hazardous substances?
simplified_guidance:
1. Ask for 'Health Register' (Form 7). 
2. Check if medical exams are updated yearly. 
3. Ensure records are accessible to workers.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload a sample anonymized page of Health Register.

legal_text: Section 41C(a): Every occupier of a factory involving any hazardous process shall maintain accurate and up-to-date health records... of the workers in the factory who are exposed to any chemical, toxic or any other harmful substances.

question_text: Are separate and adequately screened washing facilities provided for male and female workers?
applicability_criteria: All Factories employing both men and women.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check washing area (not just toilets). 
2. Are they separate? 
3. Are they screened for privacy?

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of entrances to washing facilities.

legal_text: Section 42(1)(b): Separate and adequately screened facilities shall be provided for the use of male and female workers.

question_text: Are facilities provided for storing and drying clothing?
applicability_criteria: Factories where workers change clothes (e.g. Uniforms needed).
simplified_guidance:
1. Look for lockers or cloakrooms. 
2. Check if there is a place to dry wet clothing (if applicable).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of locker room / drying stands.

legal_text: Section 43: The State Government may... make rules requiring the provision therein of suitable places for keeping clothing not worn during working hours and for the drying of wet clothing.

question_text: Are sitting arrangements provided for workers obliged to work in a standing position?
applicability_criteria: Factories where work is done standing.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify standing jobs (e.g., Assembly line). 
2. Are there chairs/stools nearby for rest intervals? 
3. Check if workers actually use them.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of chairs/stools near standing workstations.

legal_text: Section 44(1): In every factory suitable arrangements for sitting shall be provided and maintained for all workers obliged to work in a standing position.

question_text: Is there at least one first-aid box for every 150 workers?
simplified_guidance:
1. Count total workers. 
2. Count First Aid Boxes. 
3. Ratio must be >= 1 box per 150 workers. 
4. Check contents (Must not be empty).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of open first-aid box showing contents.

legal_text: Section 45(1): There shall in every factory be provided... first-aid boxes... not less than one for every one hundred and fifty workers ordinarily employed.

question_text: Is an ambulance room provided (if >500 workers)?
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify headcount (>500). 
2. If yes, check for a dedicated room with a bed, stretcher, and medical staff.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of Ambulance Room interior.

legal_text: Section 45(4): In every factory wherein more than five hundred workers are ordinarily employed there shall be provided and maintained an ambulance room.

question_text: Is a canteen provided and maintained (if >250 workers)?
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify headcount (>250). 
2. Check for a functioning canteen serving cooked food/tea. 
3. Check hygiene.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of the Canteen hall/kitchen.

legal_text: Section 46(1): The State Government may make rules requiring that in any specified factory wherein more than two hundred and fifty workers are ordinarily employed, a canteen... shall be provided.

question_text: Are shelters, rest rooms, or lunch rooms provided (if >150 workers)?
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify headcount (>150). 
2. Workers must have a place to eat packed lunch or rest. 
3. A Canteen fulfills this requirement.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of Rest Room / Lunch Room.

legal_text: Section 47(1): In every factory wherein more than one hundred and fifty workers are ordinarily employed, adequate and suitable shelters or rest rooms and a suitable lunch room... shall be provided.

question_text: Is a crche provided for children under 6 years (if >30 women)?
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify female worker count (>30). 
2. Check for a dedicated Crche room. 
3. Must be clean, lighted, and under charge of a trained woman.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of Crche room with facilities (milk/toys).

legal_text: Section 48(1): In every factory wherein more than thirty women workers are ordinarily employed there shall be provided and maintained a suitable room or rooms for the use of children under the age of six years.

question_text: Are Welfare Officers employed (if >500 workers)?
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify total worker count (>500). 
2. Ask for the name and appointment letter of the Welfare Officer.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload Appointment Letter of Welfare Officer.

legal_text: Section 49(1): In every factory wherein five hundred or more workers are ordinarily employed the occupier shall employ in the factory such number of welfare officers as may be prescribed.

question_text: Do adult workers work no more than 48 hours in any week?
simplified_guidance:
1. Pick 3 random workers. 
2. Check their attendance register/time cards for the last month. 
3. Ensure weekly total (excluding breaks) is <= 48 hours.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload a sample weekly time-sheet or attendance log.

legal_text: Section 51: No adult worker shall be required or allowed to work in a factory for more than forty-eight hours in any week.

question_text: Are workers given a weekly holiday (First day of the week/Sunday)?
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify if Sunday is the off day. 
2. If they work on Sunday, check if they get a substitute holiday within 3 days before/after. 
3. Check if notice is sent to Inspector.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload roster showing weekly offs.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Copy of notice sent to Inspector regarding substitution.

legal_text: Section 52(1): No adult worker shall be required or allowed to work in a factory on the first day of the week... unless he has or will have a holiday for a whole day on one of the three days immediately before or after the said day.

question_text: Is the daily working period limited to 9 hours?
simplified_guidance:
1. Check time-in and time-out records. 
2. Ensure actual work time does not exceed 9 hours per day (excluding rest intervals).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload daily time card sample.

legal_text: Section 54: Subject to the provisions of section 51, no adult worker shall be required or allowed to work in a factory for more than nine hours in any day.

question_text: Are workers paid twice their ordinary rate of wages for overtime work?
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify workers who did OT. 
2. Check their pay slips. 
3. Rate calculation must be: (Basic + DA) x 2. 
4. Single rate OT is a violation.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload Pay Slip showing OT rate calculation.

legal_text: Section 59(1): Where a worker works in a factory for more than nine hours in any day or for more than forty-eight hours in any week, he shall, in respect of overtime work, be entitled to wages at the rate of twice his ordinary rate of wages.

question_text: Is the Register of Adult Workers maintained and available?
simplified_guidance:
1. Ask for 'Form 12' (Register of Adult Workers). 
2. Check if it lists ALL current workers. 
3. Verify if entries match the actual people on the floor.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload a page of the Register of Adult Workers (Form 12).

legal_text: Section 62(1): The manager of every factory shall maintain a register of adult workers, to be available to the Inspector at all times... showing the name of each adult worker, the nature of his work, the group...

question_text: Is the factory free of any child worker (under 14 years)?
simplified_guidance:
1. Visually scan the floor for young children. 
2. If suspicious, ask for Age Proof (Aadhar/School Cert). 
3. ZERO TOLERANCE.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photo of general workforce (showing no children).

legal_text: Section 67: No child who has not completed his fourteenth year shall be required or allowed to work in any factory.

question_text: Do adolescent workers (15-18 years) carry a 'Certificate of Fitness' and wear a token?
simplified_guidance:
1. If young workers are present, ask for 'Form 5' (Certificate of Fitness). 
2. Check if they are wearing the metal token 'P' (Protected).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload a copy of a Certificate of Fitness (Form 5).

legal_text: Section 68: A child who has completed his fourteenth year or an adolescent shall not be required or allowed to work in any factory unless (a) a certificate of fitness... is in the custody of the manager... and (b) such child or adolescent carries... a token.

question_text: Is annual leave with wages provided (1 day for every 20 days worked)?
applicability_criteria: Workers who have worked > 240 days in a calendar year.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check the Leave Register (Form 15). 
2. Pick a worker with >1 year service. 
3. Verify leave balance calculation (Total Days / 20).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Upload a page from the Leave with Wages register (Form 15).

legal_text: Section 79(1): Every worker who has worked for a period of 240 days or more in a factory during a calendar year shall be allowed during the subsequent calendar year, leave with wages... (i) if an adult, one day for every twenty days of work performed.
